item.title: Crashing when clicking on doors :(
item.dc:creator: @runewings317 runewings317
item.description:
@runewings317 wrote:

Hey guys! I recently got Galkons Enhanced working with my PI, and it works amazingly other than this:

Exception in thread "Thread-4" java.lang.ClassCastException: Animable_Sub4 canno t be cast to Node_Sub2 at Client.method115(Client.java:8888) at Client.mainGameProcessor(Client.java:3266) at Client.processGameLoop(Client.java:2497) at RSApplet.run(RSApplet.java:145) at Client.run(Client.java:4773) at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:662)

It’s in this method:

[code]public void method115() {
if (loadingStage == 2) {
for (Node_Sub2 node_sub2 = (Node_Sub2) nodeList
.reverseGetFirst(); node_sub2 != null; node_sub2 = (Node_Sub2) nodeList
.reverseGetNext()) {
if (node_sub2.anInt1294 > 0)
node_sub2.anInt1294–;
if (node_sub2.anInt1294 == 0) {
if (node_sub2.anInt1299 < 0
|| ObjectManager.method178(node_sub2.anInt1299,
node_sub2.anInt1301)) {
method142(node_sub2.anInt1298,
node_sub2.anInt1295, node_sub2.anInt1300,
node_sub2.anInt1301, node_sub2.anInt1297,
node_sub2.anInt1296, node_sub2.anInt1299);
node_sub2.unlink();
}
} else {
if (node_sub2.anInt1302 > 0)
node_sub2.anInt1302–;
if (node_sub2.anInt1302 == 0 && node_sub2.anInt1297 >= 1 && node_sub2.anInt1298 >= 1 && node_sub2.anInt1297 <= 102 && node_sub2.anInt1298 <= 102 && (node_sub2.anInt1291 < 0 || ObjectManager
.method178(node_sub2.anInt1291,
node_sub2.anInt1293))) {
method142(node_sub2.anInt1298,
node_sub2.anInt1295, node_sub2.anInt1292,
node_sub2.anInt1293, node_sub2.anInt1297,
node_sub2.anInt1296, node_sub2.anInt1291);
node_sub2.anInt1302 = -1;
if (node_sub2.anInt1291 == node_sub2.anInt1299 && node_sub2.anInt1299 == -1)
node_sub2.unlink();
else if (node_sub2.anInt1291 == node_sub2.anInt1299 && node_sub2.anInt1292 == node_sub2.anInt1300 && node_sub2.anInt1293 == node_sub2.anInt1301)
node_sub2.unlink();
}
}
}

	}
}[/code]

And someone on Rune-Server pointed this out (dunno what it means exactly):

nodeList = null; nodeList = null; nodeList = null;

Please help!

Read full topic
